title: K-12 Mobile-Based Library Information Literacy Program for Digital Native Generations

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone/tablet usage skills and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Students, as language majors, possess advanced expertise in literature search and academic information utilization, with characteristics of digital natives familiar with mobile environments

learning_goals: Learners can accurately explain academic database search strategies with over 80% accuracy through microlearning content under 5 minutes.
Learners can independently navigate library digital resources (articles, e-books, etc.) on mobile devices with a success rate of over 90%.
Learners can critically analyze three or more academic sources using an information credibility assessment checklist.

resources: Mobile app with real-time feedback functionality

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
